review_body: Loved our stay at the Polynesian Resistance. Rooms are very comfortable and clean. Staff is professional, efficient, and friendly, especially So Jung. The location is perfect, and we enjoyed quiet at night. Enjoyed free yoga class very much. This accommodation made for a very relaxing holiday in Waikiki .

Stayed here for a night on New Years Eve with the family. The rooms were extremely clean and staff helpful. From time of check in to check out, Nick Son and his staff were above and beyond helping us with our needs

Nick at the front desk was very nice and helpful. Everywhere is walking distance and room was clean and cozy. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. I hope I can stay at this hotel once again. Mahalo!

Prior to arrival I had some concerns about our stay given the recent Trip Advisor reviews; I even considered moving to a different property. Upon check-in, all of my concerns were eliminated. There were no weird smells, soggy carpet, noise issues, or hygiene/cleanliness issues. Our room was on the pool side of the property and looked out on a quiet and picturesque view. The bed was incredibly comfortable and our room was spotless. We opted for daily parking at the nearby garage, which was arranged through the hotel. The walk to the garage was short and easy, and was much better (and probably cheaper) than trying to find our own parking arrangements. We appreciated the chairs and beach towels available from the front desk, as well as the hotel's willingness to hold our luggage after check out so we could enjoy our final day on the beach. Overall, we had a great and comfortable stay. Many thanks!

I really really love this hotel. My husband and I was comfortable here to stay. I’m from japan. And I recommend this hotel for everybody to stay. Thank you for all the staff(Frontdesk) always smiling , housekeeping (excellent) and thanks to the manager Who run in this hotel.he makes this hotel nice. Mahalo

I do not really care what view I am having or a Queen or kingbed or size of room but what I care about is hygiene.I want my room to be clean that is a minimum. So when I entered my room I found shaved hairs everywhere. In shower...in sink..in bed...So I called frontdesk. Sorry but as being a hotelmanager I would never have any of this staff working for me. The frontdesk people are not really friendly and it is like they really do not like their job. When you check in they do not give you any information about towels or the hotel itself. I am a back patient and had to carry my luggage myself!! Anyway...When I called frontdesk for the hairs, they sent somebody to clean it up. It was better but still I had to clean it up myself if I wanted it clean...not my view of being on a holiday.Also the next day I found hairs and even a dirty cloth that they forgot. They did not clean my coffee cup etc..So for me that cleaning team can defenitely improve a lot.Also the frontdesk can defenitely do better. If I have a simple question like what time does the swimmingpool has sun? I get an answer like I don't know...really?? You work there...it is a small thing to know.. But anyway.. also for you to know that if you are a light sleeper...forget to sleep before 1am. The hotel is situated at one of the bussiest streets in Honolulu...constant cars hunking...loud music,...I would never stay here again.

Clean rooms, nice staff and great location. This little hotel was perfect for our stay. We would stay there again. Reasonable price. Family friendly. They kept our bags while we went out and about until it was time to head to the airport. The room also had a small kitchenette.

We had our family staying in 3 rooms at this hotel. Every one of them smelled awful like a mix between sewerage and strong cooking oil every day and despite asking for something to be done about it, every room remained stinky. The front of the hotel is on the very noisy main road. The ‘resort’ pool has been photo shopped on the website. It’s a small, run down pool in between buildings and the sun deck is worse! Tried booking a Pearl Harbour tour at the desk, but staff had no idea what we were asking for. Go figure. For what we paid, we felt very unimpressed. To top it off , there is a resort fee of $20 USD per day. For what?? It’s no resort!
What a wonderful place to stay. In the heart of Waikiki, walking distance to everything. The staff were so friendly and helpful with everything. Amenities were fabulous, would definitely stay again.

Can’t say I was very impressed, and would never stay here again. Arrived somewhere around 8pm and was leaving early in the morning, we where immediately hit with a resort fee, even though everything was paid for, from what I could see the resort consisted of a small pool with a handful of old lounge chairs around it. Sorry not very happy about this. Got to our room, opened the door and was immediately hit by the stench. Had to open the outside doors to try and get this to clear. When we took our shoes off, found out this stench was probably caused by the wet carpets in the room, great to squelch across. In the bath room, the batch was cracked and was repaired with some form of tape, also the basin was also cracked. Best part of staying here was leaving.

We stayed at Polynesian Residence for 8 days and had a wonderful stay. Rooms spacious, modern and quiet To save parking fees we hired car from Little Hawaii rentals on a daily basis returning at night which is 2 minute walk from hotel. The hotel is centrally located and close to beaches and shops Definately recommend

Auckland, New Zealand

review_body: Our family were very happy here - great location for the beach and shops. A little noisy on the street side which we had to stay in to get an early check in (which we had to pay extra for) and resort fee a little high but it saved us packing beach towels which was great! Reception staff were polite and mostly friendly. Good size room, clean and tidy and easily met our expectations. Would stay here again definitley.

On the positive side, the rooms are quite spacious and the location is great being quite central in Waikiki, close to the beach, shopping and dining. The hotel appears to have undergone recent renovation. We liked the kitchenette with a microwave, cooktop, toaster and refrigerator. On the negative side, we could see some dark patches along the wall in the room and bathroom and could have done with better maintenance.

The hotel itself is clean, well-located, and small/boutique-y. No issues there. I actually quite liked the room.But beware you will be hit with a resort fee (surprise!) on check-in. $20/day, plus tax. What does it cover, you ask? I asked. It covers the toiletries in your shower, Wifi, water in the lobby area, and the ability to check out a beach towel to take to the beach. In other words, the basic amenities of a hotel. There is no gym, no special resort-like amenities for which your resort fee is being paid. It's just....toiletries and towels. I stayed at 3 hotels on this trip as I bounced around islands, and this was the only one that charged for toiletries and wifi.

A smaller hotel, this was a perfect place for a family with kids. Excellent and very helpful reception staff who responded immediately to address any of our questions. A nice pool and balcony. A kitchenette with a microwave, small refrigerator, toaster, cooktop, and a Keurig. Extra pillows, silverware, as well as dining and cooking utensils were great. They provide free morning yoga and lei making lessons. The resort fee (20$) also applies toward use of beach chairs, towels, boards, etc. The beach is a very short walk away and you are close to the (upscale) shopping area as well as restaurants and street performers. Pharmacy and a 7-11 are across the street. Lots of outlets in the room were great as was the really good WIFI connection. The location is in the middle of everything but we drove and the parking lot (paid) was right up the block from the hotel. In all a very positive experience with the help of very receptive front desk staff.If you are a light sleeper, the front rooms of the hotel overlook the street, which can get noisy and the back overlooks the pool, which may be quieter. The drawback was the need for repair of the ice machine, which wasn’t working, but the staff had extra ice and would fill the containers when asked.

The location is perfect, close to the beach, shopping stores and restaurants. The hotel was clean and decor was very nice. The room was perfect for four people, clean and had everything we needed, very quite. The staff was very nice, Victoria one of the housekeeper was so friendly, she always had a smile and very helpful. Planning to stay here again

Firstly,when we checked in,the wand of the bidet toilet bowl was filthy.When you push the 'wash wand' option,I was shocked to see how dirty the wand was.Then we realised the duvets on the beds were creased,like it's been used.Not with folded lines like it's clean and new.During the 4th day of house keeping,we expected our sheets to be changed as mentioned on the hotel cards.But they were not.My husband called the front desk and front desk said that they would usually change it on ' every other day'.But it's been the 4th day of our stay.The front desk told us she will get the housekeeping to change it for us the next day.We didn't bother any more because we are leaving on the next day.Not a good experience.

Have a great emplacement in the city in Waikiki. you can walk any side and come back to hotel easily...personnel is attention to us responses. have a great opportunity to sleep there is secure,clean and hansome staff also professionnal. thks for everythink .but i came back again soon in sept 19 hope i have my room i prefered. Compare in 2 years is sooo different..10 on 10 for all decoration, atmosphere and friendly reception..i am comming from Montreal canada. and is a long trip for us. thks Mahalo x

Very pleasant boutique hotel right in the middle of Waikiki. The lamp shades should be changed in room 414 and the wall paper patched by the second bed. Had everything we needed and a nice bode toilet with a heated seat. Nice bathroom and kitchenette. Nice staff and friendly housekeeper Victoria who was very accommodating. Would stay there again. Nice little touches.

I had stayed here a few years ago when it was Polynesian Plaza as I loved the location, right in the middle of Waikiki and handy to all the best shopping and restaurants......I've just stayed again July 2019 and what an improvement after renovations, new management and name change...........Large nicely appointed studio with a large modern bathroom, kitchenette and comfy queen beds. Staff are very friendly and helpful, special mention for Victoria the housekeeper for our room. I really appreciated the little touches like the icy cold lemon and lime infused water near the pool area, quality amenities, free lei making and yoga classes.....free use of beach chairs and beach towels.........I'll be back Mahalo

My husband and I stayed here for four nights. Great location in the heart of the main shopping strip and walking distance to the designer shops, restaurants and beach. Room was clean but very small and very noisy at night being in the middle of all the hustle and late night shopping. If you have your own car just be aware there is no parking in this hotel and I recommend you book parking available a block away with a $40 usd daily

Large room, nicely renovated washroom, good Tommy Bahamas toiletries, and Victoria was an excellent housekeeper- thanks a lot for your service! They have free beach chairs and towels for their guests. Overall, really good experience!

First time here and it was a nice big space. Room was clean and comfortable. Love the bathroom. Great staff. Thanks to Annabelle, Winston & Jeff. They were very helpful and friendly. We loved our stay here.

This hotel is located right in Waikiki. While not on the beach it is only a couple of blocks away. There is a nice pool. The rooms are spacious, clean and comfortable. We stayed on the street side. It was a little noisy at times but never disturbed our sleep. If you are a light sleeper you should request a room on on the other side of the hotel. The staff was universally pleasant and helpful. We would certainly stay there again when we return to Honolulu.

Very Awesome services of Winston,Anabelle & Jeff.Good customer service,very friendly and helpful staffs.Very clean room and bathroom.Highly recommended and it was a great experience.Hopefully to be back here soon

Reasonable prices. great position. Free yoga and lei making. The most comfortable bedding!! Great staff and concierge who looked after our bags while we island hopped. Beach towels and chairs available.

Overall, this was a pretty decent hotel. The staff were very friendly and the room was quite spacious. The location is amazing and within walking distance of the main Waikiki strip. Nearby restaurants also offered discounts if you stay at this hotel. The pool area was very small but honestly, it remained almost always empty when we stayed so nice for a quick dip! Best part of the room are the cool Japanese toilets and endless channels to peruse through.Only cons were that our room had a weird odour to it when we entered. And it was a bit more beaten down with drawers and cabinets that didn’t close properly. Also, we were given the wheelchair accessible room even though we didn’t request one. The extra handrails in the shower and pullout chair in the tub were a nuisance. Thought we would get a regular tub combo or a glass shower as advertised when we booked. We are young and always take the stairs instead of the elevators as well so felt somebody could have benefitted more from this room (unless they just needed to sell it out during the time we stayed).

We stayed here for a week, over Easter break. And we have only positive things to say about the hotel. Our room was super clean( important for me!), and housekeeping great. The receptionists was helpful and friendly, and with a smaller hotel they did have time for you and was always up for a friendly chat. We could rent beach chairs for free, there was a lei and yoga classes, the pool area looked nice, but we never had a chance to use it. Mint and lemon water all day long to sip on when you arrived back to the hotel. We had a little kitchenette in the room too, great for a snack or breakfast. And how can you go wrong with being one of the next door neighbors to Hard Rock cafe! We ordered food from there and eat it in the room watching a movie in bed. We loved our little little balcony too, where we could watch the Marathon Runners passing by! You can walk everywhere! We will recommend the hotel and will stay next time for sure.

We really enjoyed staying in this part of Waikiki - not so busy with those funny touristy shops but still close to the better beaches of Waikiki. Easy walking distance to the Royal Hawaiian Centre. Great Ramen place downstairs to.

We stayed for 4 nights. Let’s start with the positives: The hotel is situated in a convenient location, so convenient that our rental car sat in the carpark for 2 days. Room was clean, housekeeping was great. The toilet was Japanese style. There was always lemon and mint water available. You could also rent beach chairs for free. They also had a pool however we didn’t have time to make use of it. Receptionists were always friendly and helpful.Now the not so good: Parking was $28 a day and was charged from noon regardless of when you checked in. This I found expensive but it seems to be normal in the area. We also had to pay a resort fee which I think should have been included in the price of the room. The internet was extremely slow which was frustrating at times. Overall it wasn’t a perfect stay but it wasn’t a bad one either. I would recommend based on location and facilities.

I initially booked this because of the amazing deal compared to other hotels in the area and was more than pleasantly surprised. Those hotel is walking distance from the convention center and in a very nice part of town. It is well appointed with friendly staff. The rooms were clean with nice balconies. Though it is next to the Hard Rock Cafe, it was quiet at night and there was minimal road noise. The pool is beautiful with a very nice patio and there are free beach chair and towel rentals. Great value and would definitely stay there again!

We were a party of four and had a great stay. The location is great, near to everything. You can walk a few steps from the hotel and there a lot of good dining places. Waikiki beach is nearby. The room was great, modern and clean, newly renovated and has a pool. When you enter the lobby, it smells good as well as the hall ways. My only complain is that the fresh smell should follow the room and the bathroom. That said, I will still recommend it and most likely will come back and stay here.

This is a great little hotel. We had a room on the top floor, overlooking the pool. Great Waikiki vibe. Yes, you could hear the crowd having fun at Arnold's in the evenings. That's OK. That's Waikiki.The best thing about this hotel is the staff. Very warm and friendly folks. Our housekeeper, Catherine, was super attentive, and went out of her way to make our stay special. If I get another chance, I will be back for sure. Mahalo!

Hotel is loud in the evenings. You can hear resturaunt from across pool area till 3 or 4am. Pool itself is quiet there are also only 6 sun chairs, we soon realized why. The water is freezing and is not heated. No hot tub either. Website has slippers and other listed in amenities which do not appear to be in the room. Owner was not very friendly. They are not accommodating if you have children. We graciously asked for a late check out because we have 2 children one 2.5yr and one 11m old who both need naps before flights home. We were told they would be a 70 dollar fee for and extra 2 hours in the hotel( mind you we never used the house keeping in the 7 days we were here and checked in after midnight on the 1st day we stayed) we will never stay here again and will not recommend this hotel to family of friends. They seemed more interested in making a few extra bucks over keeping a customer. Its really too bad!

Thanks so much to staff who have, most importantly, made the experience here great. Kiani was helpful throughout the whole stay and showed great character, personality, and professionalism. And to the rest of the staff who have done a wonderful job in keeping up with the quality of living -- My room was always clean like it was newly rented. A definite hidden gem in a great location of Waikiki.

The newly renovated hotel is a dream in the midst of lots of larger hotels. Close to lots of restaurants and the beach. The rooms were extremely clean and comfortable. After a week at a less than lovely VRBO for work, it was a great place to land and rest. The beach is a block away. Bathrooms are lovely and the automated toilets a nice touch. There is a frig and microwave and plenty of storage if you were going to be there for a longer stay
