review_body: This is a small boutique hotel with lovely rooms, well proportioned, very comfortable beds, nice bathrooms and a coffee machine to boot. The pool area is small but lovely, much better than sitting with 100 other people at the big hotels. The staff here are so helpful, loaning us towels even after we had checked out so we could go snorkelling in the morning before collecting our bags in the afternoon. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. It is in a great location, only a few minutes walk from the beach and close to shops and buses.

Stayed at the Polynesian Residences and found it to be perfect for us. The location was off the beach a bit, but was an easy trek down to the beach. The hotel even offers free beach chairs to rent. Seemed to be centrally located to most of the action in Waikiki beach too as we pretty much walked everywhere. Hotel was always clean and employees were helpful. Definitely would stay again and had no problems.

We stayed at this hotel during high season so my review is shaded by the high cost. We thought the room would have more of a “real” kitchen but compared to other hotel rooms, it just had a few burners (no stove) and a toaster. Be careful about picking a room. The hotel is on a busy street and if you are on a low floor, it’s both very noisy late into the night and not particularly private. Other lower floor rooms look onto a courtyard. The toilet includes seat warmers and a bidet. Being an American family with little experience with such things, we were both highly amused and kind of weirded out. The bed was very comfortable. The tv had a zillion channels but not much to watch.

The fire/security alarm went off from one of the stores on the first floor of the building at least 10 times per night for three days straight, causing my family members to lose three nights of sleep. We made complaints multiple times, but clearly the problem was left unsolved for three days. All we get as compensation for losing three nights of sleep that led to sickness and ruined our family vacation is 60 dollars. Hotel rooms were also not cleaned until the late afternoon.The location itself was already horrible with all the noise from the street located directly in front of the rooms, but the alarm ruined it all.Would never return.

This is a small hotel in the heart of Wakiki but on the less hectic end just a few doors down from Hardrock CafeRecent remodel has give this hotel a lovely face lift. Rooms are well appointed and beds are comfortable. The pool area is lovely and quaint.The staff friendly and helpful. We came from Australia and arrived very early. They did everything possible to get us checked in early.They have no gym but offer free yoga at 9am daily. Vanessa was lovely and it was a great class. If you are looking for the big resort experience with activities and private beach, this hotel is not for you. But if you don’t mind walking a short distance to the beach, they offer free chairs and towels. I appreciated this hotel for all it had to offer and would stay here again. It is half the price of most the neighbors Aloha

The location was fantastic! Walking distance to everything, shopping,eating, and the beach. This is what I consider a hidden gem! Probably not great if you’ve rented a car, not sure about the parking situation, price to park, etc. I walked everywhere or Ubered! The room was very clean. I came by myself and was a bit worried about safety! I felt perfectly safe staying here alone. There was always someone at he front desk. The staff was very pleasant and extremely helpful. They called a tour company for me and arranged my tour. Gloria, at the front desk, was so helpful and accommodating. My only negative comment was I felt the price of the room was a tad bit pricey for its size, but it’s Hawaii!I would definitely recommend this establishment to friends and family. Aloha until we meet again!Thanks so much!

This is a beautiful, modern and clean hotel right in the tony part of town. Great day and night activities right outside and close walk to the beach. Good price. We stayed at another hotel nearby that was pretty awful that was almost the same price, so this was a deal. we stayed in connecting rooms called the Family Suite. 2 double beds in one room with own bath, and king Bed in the other room. Loved the Toto toilets. What a pleasure to find this hotel. Recommend highly.

First off, the location is smack dab in the beginning of Waikiki, close to many shops, restaurants, beach access and even a museum that has free admission just 5 minutes away. The building itself has shops and even a ramen restaurant fronting Kalakaua Avenue, alongside the hotel's entrance. I was able to leave my room and found everything I needed just steps from the hotel. From mouthwash, to socks, beer, food and even a 7-11 and CVS Pharmacy that are open 24 hours and located just across the street. The staff were very welcoming as well... Hung je, Sam, Winston, and a few other staff are always friendly and greeting everyone around. The environment of the hotel and the room interior are very comfortable. The pool is amazing, with 2 or 3 tiled Honu (turtle on the pool floor), also a large flat screen outside, with some tables and lounge chairs to enjoy a beverage/meal or just chill and read a book. They only have 5 floors, which is perfect for our commute to go out and explore, and not stay cooped in the rooms. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend this place to anyone looking to stay in Waikiki on a budget and time managing circumstances.

My girlfriend and I very much enjoyed our stay at the Polynesian Residences during this past Thanksgiving holiday. The hotel is conveniently located in the heart of Waikiki next to shopping and the beach. We were especially impressed with the stylish well kept appearance, great amenities along with a staff consisting of some of the most accommodating people I have ever encountered at a hotel. Service charges I suppose are inevitable in Hawaii however I didn't mind so much with this hotel as the overall effort was above and beyond expectation.

キッチン付きのツインルームに5泊滞在しました。キッチンは小さいながらもそこそこ揃っていました。夕食を作るのはちょっと無理があるものの、簡単な朝食にはちょうど良いサイズでした。We stayed 5 nights at twin bed room with kitchen. Kitchen is small but well equipped, having microwave, IH grill and dishes. It is too small for preparing dinner, but OK for breakfast. Room was clean and usual size. There was no dining table and we had to use bed side table for in room dining, it would be good to have table and chairs. Location is very convenient, close to shops and restaurants. We can receive some discount at Bills and some restaurants close by. Staffs are very friendly and helpful. We were looking forward to swimming pool, but it was in sun shade most of the day and water was too cold in Dec. we couldn’t use it. Overall I think it reasonable place to stay in the middle of Waikiki. Maybe come back in summer.

I love the location of the place. Very close to stores. Our room was in 3rd floor and it was very clean and well organize. All the staffs ar very friendly always. Aleli was our favorite staff. She was very polite and very helpful to us and to every guest. I will absolutely stay in this hotel again in my next visit in Waikiki.

Had an unexpected layover in Honolulu and found this hotel at the last minute. The rates were very reasonable. The room was exactly as described. Nicely revisited bathrooms and room. Small fridge, coffee maker, and WiFi. Nice pool. FYI - This hotel is on the Main Street and does not face the beach.

We came in late and were greeted and arranged our parking pass in a close by parkade. Very friendly staff everyday. Our room was on 4th floor facing the pool with a small kitchenette which was handy for breakfast and lunch. Very quite, excellent a/c clean, and up to date. Would definitely recommend and stay here again.

Wonderful hotel, very friendly staff, clean comfortable rooms. Nice and quiet. The small kitchenette was very nice and usable, and included all the dishes, and cooking equipment you would need.The heat and AC unit was easy to use and very quiet.The rooms were spotless and very comfortable.Great staff and extras like providing towels and chairs for the beach at no additional cost. And a great location to boot.We will be staying there again for certain.

Stay away! Circled around the building twice before actually finding it. There is no parking, you will end up parking under a different building at no discounted rate.Parked in a parking lot nearest to them for an hour while dealing with the receptionist (read below) before finally being directed to the cheaper lot. That was an extra $15 bucks. Price sounds great and the reviews seem solid, DON'T DO IT. This place is a hole in the wall, and not like in a good way like your favorite Mexican restaurant. Tiny rooms to go along with the tiny water bottles they give out. The full size waters are only $4. Booked a room for a staycation with my wife recently through their company website full price, no Priceline or anything. When we arrived we were received warmly and then offered a hilariously small room with 2 twin beds! The room actually would have benefited if they were bunk beds as there was no space left to walk around the beds the room was so cramped. Obviously that room wouldn't work for the occasion. The receptionist was understanding and to her credit, apologized and tried to help out. Astonishingly though, they were all out of king size bed rooms on a non eventful Thursday. I only saw or heard 1 other guest during our time there...guess they only have that 1 king room they use in all their pictures! She offered an upgrade to their executive room for 50 dollars, and after some back and forth I begrudgingly agreed. She called her manager to get the approval, unfortunately for the employees, they are all micromanaged. The manager denied the request and refused any discount. At this point it would be more than double my initial cost to pay to upgrade. I was ready to pay the cancellation fee and just go somewhere else when I was informed about the cancellation policy. For me to cancel, I would be charged 1 full night's reservation... My full amount. Having only a little pride left I was done and leaving. No cancellation, just leaving. Then she came up with another idea, the family suite. This was a conjoined double room and had a king bed and 2 twin beds. If I remember right it was about 100 to upgrade, still nearly doubling my cost but at this point I knew they had won, they didn't need to be nice they had my money either way. It was clever marketing, bait and switch and complete lack of real customer service but it worked. No discount given, they made more money and I was given a smile and new room key. The room was fine and we made sure to test all the beds just to get our money's worth! Made the best of it and until finding mold growing out of the air vent we'd considered the whole event neutral. Keep in mind I live here, I understand it's humid and stuff grows fast...but mold in the air vent is dangerous and unacceptable. Call it icing on the cake but realizing you just paid (nearly)double what you should have to breath mold all night kind of put a damper on the rest of the weekend. Looking at the picture you may think it's dirt or dust (which is somehow better?) But I assure you it is not. Mahalo all

Overall our experience at this Hotel was excellent! Great location and Staff. Hotel was very clean and tidy at all times. The only issue we had was that we did not initially get the room we booked. The room(#315) was set up for someone with a disability even though we were told it was not. I have pictures of the seat and rails in the tub as well as the 2 peep holes in the door(one lower for someone in a wheelchair) which I won't post here. We were only moved when we pointed out that the tub was leaking into the hall and the faucet leaked so badly that it kept us awake at night. We were moved to a very nice room with a quiet view of the pool but no refund was offered for our inconvenience. Other than that our experience was superb and I would still recommend this hotel highly!!

I struggled on whether to give this an “average” or “very good” rating. Wish TripAdvisor has a “good” category. Rooms are clean, decent size, good WiFi, and well-located to the main shopping street in Waikiki. The big downside for us was the noise. We were first given a room facing the street and the sound of traffic was too much to us. The hotel graciously moved us facing the rear which is far quieter. There’s no dining option at the hotel. Some rooms have a kitchenette which is helpful if you want buy some breakfast food. There are many restaurants nearby.

We found this resort very friendly and helpful. We especially enjoyed Kiani who was special! She was very knowledgeable, friendly and helpful. Storage of our luggage while we went on a tour was extremely helpful

Great place to stay. Great costumer service. The staff were very friendly and helpful especially Alile, Annabelle, & Winston. I wou’ld difinitely book at polenesian residence again in my next visit to waikiki.

Hotel itself was great, clean modern rooms, ( including a bidet) and very conveniently located. Parking ( in Waikiki) is expensive, so if you have car it's about a block walk to their parking garage. Safe area, 1 block to beach and a great place to stay. Highly recommended.

The Polynesian residences was a fantastic hotel. great location. right next to hard rock café. and plenty of shopping all around. beach was just a block away . the trolley for transport was just around the corner and so was a post office. . the hotel has just recently been renovated. the hotel always smelt nice, . The staff from front counter to the housekeeping were fantastic, friendly and always said hello to us every time they seen us. We stayed in a 2 bedroom room it had 2 kitchens . 2 bathrooms a balcony 2 queen beds and a king bed and plenty of room . the beds were comfy. . the pool area is lovely to . . the hot water in the showers was lovely and hot. . it also has a japenese bidet. and the toilet seat was heated. the bathroom was spacious to. we had airconditioning. it worked well.. they gave a us cold water on arrival which is nice on a hot day . I will be staying here next time I visit Hawaii. . but the best part of my stay was the staff they were wonderful, great customer service. and friendly that's what I like when I stay in a hotel.. 10/10. It also has a washing machine and dryer for use

The room was super clean and comfy, the employees were professional, helpful, friendly and courteous. I felt I had their exclusive attention when I needed anything from a beach towel or directions or recommendations to the best places to eat. The best part of this hotel for me was the Yoga class in the morning. What a great start to my day in this beautiful paradise.

Highly recommended. Great price. Fantastic rooms great size. Great location, walking distance to alot of shops and restaurants. And super friendly staff. Couldn't ask for much more. Will most definitely be coming back.

So, I literally have never written any review online before but am going out of my way to do it for this hotel. The people were exceptional, kind, helpful - true spirit of aloha. Hotel is in a very busy area but we rarely heard anything outside (very occasional “hoot” from party goers outside). Never interrupted sleep or anything. We had a poolside room. Could see the Friday night fireworks from our room - nice plus. Important to note - a lot of reviews were negative because of remodeling. The remodeling is done now. Very nice hotel and great service. Convenient location for all things Waikiki. Highly recommend.

Stayed on the 1st floor found to be rather noisy so could not have balcony door open. Cleaners were also noisy vacuuming around 9 pm and slamming closet door and our room door which was situated next to our room early morning. There was a smell which I think came from nearby eateries coming into room which wasn’t good. Room was clean and aircon worked well, bathroom and ammenities were nice. Reception was ok. Location was good too value for money

We had the opportunity to stay at Polynesian Residences and it was FABULOUS!!! We absolutely love the new look! We love the great apricot-like smell when you enter the hotel...it’s very refreshing! The room and the bathroom are very spacious. We love that it has a kitchenette and that the shower in the bathroom has a door and not a curtain. We also liked that there is a balcony that overlook Kalakaua St....to enjoy the hustle and bustle below when we are in our room. I believe they may have rooms not facing the street side so you can request it if it’s too noisy. On certain days they offer free yoga and lei making classes. They also offer free beach chairs and if it happens to rain, an umbrella. They don’t have a big pool area, but the new look is awesome! They also offer discounts to the stores and restaurants located to their left and right side. All staff members were very nice, welcoming, helpful, and friendly! We will definitely be staying here again and thank you for making our stay a happy and memorable one!

I booked 2 rooms for the four of us girls to explore Waikiki for 5 days. This looked like a good location and the prices was very resonable. I may have not been expectingmuch because I managed my friends expectations with descriptions like it was a small hotel, no frills, just a place for us to sleep. I was so happy to find out that it was so much more. Yes, small, but, that was really great. The staff were accomidating and helpful and they wanted you to have a great stay. The rooms were recently renovated so it was clean and updated and had many modern conveniences like a multi pronged mobile device power cord attached to the clock, toilets that have many buttons (my partner wants one now), Tommy Bahama shampoos and creams and Kurig coffee and tea. They also had Tommy Bahama beach chairs to use for free along with beach towels. We had a day around the pool which was fun. They just need a few more lounge chairs. Let's say that the water was refreshing. Do the pool before the beach or you won't use the pool. Overall, we would recommend this place and would stay there again.

My wife and I love this place. We live in Hawaii and occasionally like a getaway to Waikiki. We found this place by accident. Our room had a street view and I’m not sure if they offer an ocean view. It’s location is within walking distance of where all the action is , the room was spacious and extremely clean. The parking was a little strange because you need to park about a block away in a garage, but no big deal. We can’t wait to return, so far the best bang for the buck we have found!

I loved staying here. It's in a great location, and I liked that it is a smaller hotel, not one of those giant ones next door that feel more touristy and less intimate. The room was modern and clean. The bed was super comfortable. And I looved the Japanese toilet! Try one out and you'll see what I mean. I will definitely be back here the next time I visit Waikiki.

I spent 3 nights at the Polynesian Residences Waikiki Beach and had a magnificent stay. Gloria (Guest Services Manager) was super friendly and helpful. Hotel is more like a small boutique hotel and I enjoyed the quality of the rooms and ambiance of the hotel. If you want to get away from the big resorts and stay in the heart or Waikiki and literally only 5 minutes to the beach - this is the hotel. Uber to/from the airport was around $25. I also took the bus to the Ala Moana Center and walked home - about 15-20 minutes. Great hotel - Friendly and knowledgeable Staff. Would recommend and stay again.

This hotel is recently been refurbished, is as per the photos.Lovely small hotel with lovely staff.Great location right next to Hard Rock Cafe.The hotel supply fresh beach/pool towels every day and also have beach chairs to take with you which was amazing idea as made our beach trips great.The only issue we had was the air con, it wouldn’t go any lower than 24c so at night felt too hot. Did tell the staff but still didn’t go any lower.We preferred his hotel over the larger hotels and would defiantly come back.

Awesome hotel. Comtemporary / modern rooms, friendly staff and great location near shops and beach. Right on the stip but still very quiet. Imagine it would be hard to find much better accomodation at these rates.
user_name:
Alex B
Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

review_body: We just got back from a week stay here. The staff were superb, especially Victoria, Sonny, and Eu Jin. The bed was extremely comfortable, the bathroom very clean, and our pool-facing room was quiet and relaxing. Only wish they had more hooks in the bathroom to hang our wet bathing suits.They have free beach chairs and towel service, and the location was perfect.

I stayed in Oahu for a week with my parents for a family vacation, and we were looking for a hotel that would be decent but affordable. We definitely found that and more with Polynesian Residences. When we checked in, we were greeted by a very nice and professional receptionist who presented us with fresh, scented, and dampened hand towels to use after our long flight. Our first impression of the hotel was that it was air conditioned (which we had assumed would be the case but found out isn't always the case for Hawaiian hotels) and had a pleasant smell throughout. We took an elevator up to our room, which was a clean, modern, pleasant-appearing room with 2 queen beds. We had no trouble signing in to our free Wi-Fi. The bathroom was very clean, modern, bright, had a nice shower (no bathtub), and a Japanese toilet. There was a very small balcony that was unfurnished which we didn't really use (except to occasionally dry out swimsuits), but you could conceivably fit two or three small chairs out there. We had a room with a small kitchenette -- the sink, stovetop, Keurig machine, and provided dishes were useful but there wasn't really a lot of counter space. My biggest critique would be the lack of counter space and walking-room around the beds, but I still found what we paid for the room well worth it. Our room overlooked a pool that wasn't very large, but was private and never crowded during our stay. I used the pool three times and found the temperature very comfortable. We also had laundry facilities in the hotel that had 2 washing machines and 1 dryer that took quarters for payment (the concierge also had detergent available for sale if needed). During our stay, we used the laundry facilities twice and did not have to wait much (if at all) either time for a washer or dryer. The hotel had a subtle entrance that was on a main street in Waikiki, which was a short walk to nearby restaurants and also to the beach (a little over 5 min). If you are looking for a modern, comfortable, affordable hotel that isn't upscale or right on the beach, then Polynesian Residences is definitely one that you should consider.

If you don’t want to pay the huge Waikiki beach prices but want to be close by (1 block away) then this is the hotel for you. It is a 5 minute walk to the beach. The room was excellent, comfy bed and a good size as was the bathroom. The staff were helpful. This is not a big chain but is great value and good quality. We would definitely go back.

Recently we stayed at the Polynesian Residences at Waikiki Beach, the room was roomy enough & the A/C system worked really well, unfortunately our room was on the 2nd floor & overlooked the main road so the road noise was extremely loud which made it difficult to open the door to let the n any fresh air, there was also a lot of noise up to around 2 am from the nearby cafes, there was also a awful smell as you entered the room, not sure what this was from but it wasn,t pleasant. If you were looking at staying at this place make sure you book a room facing the pool at the rear, other than that the price was good & the staff were friendly & helpful.

I arrived to an amazing reception and it continued my whole stay.The room had everything I needed as I had been upgraded. My room overlooked the pool and was nice and quiet. Location was really good so handy to the beach just a block away.

Moved to this hotel after staying at another hotel at Ala Moana Blvd. No regrets at all! This is a small boutique hotel which is few steps from Hard Rock cafe. It is a few minutes walk to Fort Derussy and less than 10 mins walk to Waikiki Beach. Along the way Duty Free, malls, shops, restaurants, groceries etc are close by.Room is new, spacious and clean. Hotel should maintain it well to keep the quality. My room is away from the street so no noise issue except could hear upstairs guests talking one afternoon. Other than that most days noise level was ok.Hotel offers complimentary yoga and hula lessons twice a week, nice touch!My flight was delayed due to a weather conditions managed to check out at 1 pm unable to get a room for quick shower before leaving hotel. Understand the hotel is planning to build a shower room at pool area. This will be highly appropriated. Staff are mostly young and helpful especially Yu Jin & Sunny. I will definitely stay here again if back in Oahu, highly recommend!

Only stayed here due to (my own) cock up with a hotel booking at another place....didn't book the dates we needed, hotel was full and couldn't extend our room, so we had to urgently look for another place nearby for one night....and voila. Came here. ABSOLUTELY a beautiful place. Even the little touches (like the cool cloths and water during check in) were perfect. We had a room overlooking the pool (so nice and quiet so we slept so well), and everything was spotlessly clean. Great having the wee kitchenette and sink, too.Wish we'd stayed here the entire time we were in Hawaii. Would definitely stay here again if we ever make it back.Oh, and the toilet was futuristic.....Japan-style......amazing.....

We loved our stay so much that we would stay there again without hesitation! Excellent location, friendly staff, spacious and clean rooms.It is within walking distance from the beach and the pool is magical, especially at night.

I liked this hotel, it was much smaller than most in Waikiki, and staff was very friendly and also knew who we were (only stayed for 2 nights). Location is great and room is fine. I liked the free yoga and hula classes, we did a yoga one and really enjoyed it.

Located on the main strip, close to restaurants & shops. Short walk to the beach. Free beach chair rental. Rooms are newly renovated. Clean & modern. A little on the small side for two adults and two teens but not in the room too often. Nice, quiet pool area. Staff friendly & polite. Only negative is the replenishment of towels etc. We had four people in our room and they never replenished with enough towels or toilet paper. All in all, a lovely stay and would stay again.

Overdue review. Stayed here for 6 nights. Location is great, near beach and shopping. Staffs are friendly and hopeful. Renovation was going on so please contact to make sure renovations are done. Downside: like the other reviewer said, korean? "general manager" needs to take management lesson. Quiet unfriendly and said no to every request :o. I thought he s supposed to know customer service. However, the staffs are very helpful so i always avoid dealing with the manager. Overall, if you got a good deal and out most of the time, then you can consider it due to location.

Anything you would desire is withinany walking distance. Friendly staff and housekeeping. The only drawback is parking at the unloading zone to unload your baggage although this is somewhat typical of the area. The lodging and staff make up for this small delay! I will stay again!

Located right on the upmarket shopping strip of Waikiki it is only a block away from the beach, so it is a great area to explore Hawaii from. It’s a new hotel and the rooms are clean, spacious and well appointed. There is a great balcony over looking the shopping strip which would be lovely to sit on with a glass of wine and watch the (very interesting) world go by but there is no outside furniture unfortunately, which is the thing that’s lets it down, otherwise I would have scored it a 5. It also doesn’t provide any breakfast.

We stayed here for a few nights due to the hurricane Lane coming our direction. The stay was okay and rooms fine. There is some trafic noice and the wi-fi is only available in the room but apart from this wr had a nice stay and luckely the hurricane never came this way.

Great boutique hotel in Waikiki! The rooms were updated and very clean. It’s in a convenient location- the beach is a 5min walk away and great shopping is at your doorstep! Parking can be an issue, but there is a parking garage across the street. The staff were great and very helpful!! We forgot a souvenir family pic and only realized it when we returned home (4 days AFTER we checked out). After contacting the hotel (Mahalo Yujin!), they found our souvenir and held onto it long enough for our friend also vacationing in Waikiki to pick it up for us. Overall, we had a great stay at the Polynesian Residences.

An absolutely wonderful stay. Super clean rooms and common areas. Recently renovated inside and out. Located in the most desirable part of the Waikiki common area. Close to everything yet far enough from the heavier traffic areas. A short walk to beach, stores and entertainment. Secure and clean parking offered just across the street for a reasonable rate. Total stay was thirteen days. Every day resulted in a consistently happy experience in all categories. Best of all were the staff. All were cheerful, helpful and simply wonderful people. Kiani, Sonny (Tito Sonny),Gloria, Nick and Tati thank you for such excellent service. Your personalities are truly an asset to Polynesian Residences and I would most definitely return and stay there without a doubt. Our entire family shares the same sentiment. Great job, thank you and God bless you all!

We recently spent 10 glorious days in Waikiki for our honeymoon. And we found this place online and thank god we did! Affordable, friendly, clean, resort style, beautiful pool, comfortable bed and pillow, endless channels on a HD TV, great shower and bathroom and in the heart of Waikiki, walking distance to Waikiki beach, shops and restaurants. We loved what this place had to offer. And thank you for contributing to our wonderful honeymoon. We will forever remember you.

The best thing is the location, you can walk to shopping and dining areas in honolulu and to waikiki beach. Rooms are big and clean, bathrooms are new. Swimming pool is really small, only suitable for a quick refresh. Good hotel if you don’t plan to stay at the hotel during the day. Bad things: They charge a resort fee even if there is no resort at all... and even if the room was ready when we arrived we had to pay for an early check-in fee because it was before 3pm...

This hotel is well situated in the heart of Waikiki adjacent to very busy and good shopping retailers and food providers.The room we had was very clean and tidy and well appointed. Quiet efficient air con.Staff were pleasant and helpfulParking is at a premium in this area and the hotel has an arrangement nearby.

What a super little hotel. Easy to locate, newly renovated, clean rooms, friendly and courteous staff, great little pool with a sun deck up top and located minutes from the beach, shopping and dining. Easy access to public transportation. Really enjoyed the Polynesian Residences and based on cost and overall value, will make this the choice for us when we return to Waikiki. Very impressed! Made all the difference on our trip!

Good location - close enough to beach (although not the nice part of beaches) and close to the shops. Bloody good shrimp truck just down the road. Handy to ABC store and drug store for quick bites or drink. Unfortunately during our stay the pool was closed and they were renovating. This made for a loud stay. The pool being out of action was really disappointing as we were very much looking forward to chilling out poolside. When we arrived after a long 10 hour flight our room wasn’t ready and they advised to come back in an hour. When we came back it still wasn’t ready - felt like we had to keep coming back and going away - when all we wanted was to check in! It would have been nice at the start to advise what time exactly to come back to check in so it didn’t muck the day up. Staff however were lovely and friendly, room was always cleans - lots of shakas

The hotel was a great surprise! Much better than expected and a real value for the money! We have to thank the wonderful Tati for all the pool towels and saving our lost phone on the last day! She really made my daughter’s day!! Such a great thing to find nice friendly people during holidays! She gave us the real Aloha spirit!! Thanks!!

We were in a bit of a pickle with a hotel we booked, and we weren’t satisfied with the services. THEN, The Polynesian Residences answered our call, and we were able to book for a two week stay with them. The staff and overall experience was AMAZING and WONDERFUL. The staff are friendly and provided five star services. The hotel room was comfortable and the pool was amazing. MAHALO POLYNESIAN RESIDENCES for an amazing experience!

After two weeks on 3 Hawaiian islands this place was pretty goodCompetitive price (compared to other exhorbitant hotels in HLL) and smack bang in the center of the action5 min walk to beach, decent pool and professional staff We were only there for 1 night but wished we had found it earlier in our trip

Was very happy with this hotel and would stay here again. The service was fabulous, they were there 24/7 so assist us when needed. The location was great, we walked everywhere and caught buses to ala moana and other places. Close to great restaurants and shops.They cleaned the rooms and changed towels daily which was a nice. The pool area is great with comfortable lounges and a nice warm pool.

We stayed here the latter part of June. We were greeted nicely on check in with no hassles. Our room was clean, newly renovated with an awesome Japanese bidet toilet. Despite facing the main road, noise was not a huge issue and the balcony (although small), provided nice views of strip. There is a small kitchenette with a microwave and coffee machine, although to be truthful not sure how many people would use the microwave, but it's there. There is a nice pool which we found handy after a long day out and although the pool area is renovated, with new deck lounges, there are still small ongoing works to improve the ambience as the area is surrounded by restaurants and other buildings. In saying this, people should not be expecting a five star resort pool but it's a more than pleasant for a swim and lounge about. There is no bar or restaurant onsite however the location means all that is a short walk away, and there is an offer for meals discounts for guests at close by restaurants like Bills Hawaii and the Hard Rock Cafe.Pool towels are provided and also if you are heading out to the beach or a snorkel tour, you just ask reception;they also provide beach chairs. We found staff to be polite and helpful without being over the top. If anyone knows how many large commercialized hotels are in Waikiki, this hotel is a gem and provides nice accommodation without the hustle and bustle of the larger hotels. Would definitely stay again. Well done guys!

Vacation June2-9th family of 4, great location but overall service was like any hotels, cleaning staff where good but we used the bed card left on the bed to change the sheets after 3 days and they were not changed. The hotel manager(tall skinny asian guy was so unfriendly&rude)take a lesson guy on management. Friendly staff greeted with towel and water on arrival, was not hard to find as others posted. Very disappointed that the pool was not open and could have been if they weren't so slow, power washing the deck, painted the roof top not anywhere near the pool,hanging flowers on the fake grass walls, waste of time completing as you could have had the pool open for the visitors. Was told it was going to open June 6th then June 7th, on and on. Noise level was okay no complaints like others posted. Lobby seating area was not completed so everyone had to stand as there was only enough for 5 people to sit down. We stayed on the 3rd floor room 313, saw the fireworks from the balcony, and a view of a nice pool but could not use:(, They should try renovations earlier and have staff work quickly as we saw everyday a few slugs working. Would we go back, probably yes,but there are many hotels also so many competition out there hence "manager", close to the beach within 12 mins walk, bus is just around the corner. Enjoyed our time and would go back again next year to Hawaii but a different hotel.

The staff are very welcoming and friendly. The room was spacious and clean with a modern touch (hotel was still undergoing renovations while we were there). Bed was large and comfortable, sleep quality good. Air conditioning is not noisy like other places I've stayed at. I liked the coffee/tea machine, easy to use. I couldn't work out all the controls on the Japanese-style toilet though!Hot water takes quite a while to come out of the shower. Rooms facing Kalakaua Ave can be subject to street noise at night (loud cars, drunk people shouting) but didn't disrupt sleep too much. A few additional items would make the stay more comfortable in rooms with a kitchenette: some dishwashing detergent, a dish scrubber, a colander and another chair. Two people cannot sit down at the desk to eat when there is only one chair!Location very handy to bus stops on Saratoga Rd around the corner - to key destinations such as Pearl Harbour, Diamond Head, Ala Moana Center, Hanauma Bay.I would gladly stay again if visiting Oahu in future.

We visited Waikiki for the first time ever and were lucky enough to stay at The Polynesian Residences. It could not be more perfectly located right on Kalakaua Avenue, next to Hard Rock Cafe! The staff were soooo friendly, always saying ‘Aloha’ even when we weren’t looking. The only shame was the pool & outdoor area was being completely renovated and we didn’t know about it, however that does make us want to come back as it was looking unreal! Definitely would recommend.

Most people who are commenting on the noise are commenting because of the construction. The pool area is under construction as it is a portion of the lobby. This should be finished soon. This did not hinder our stay whatsoever And I knew this when booking. The entrance and reception area have been completely remodeled and are fabulous. We were warmly greeted with fresh hot towels and bottles of water upon check-in. The remainder of the lobby and still under construction and there were saws and hammering going on while we were checking in. Slightly annoying, but expected. We got up to our room and we were so pleased to see how well appointed the room was. The inside of this hotel is five stars all the way. The construction stopped at a decent hour and began on Saturday morning at a decent hour. I’m sitting in our room facing the pool right now and we can hear the construction going on outside but it’s not unbearable. This place is going to be awesome once it’s finished!The proximity to everything cannot be beat. We are a block from the beach, and along the way are some of the best food trucks we’ve ever eaten from. This place is a great value during construction as their rates have dropped. I highly recommend anyone staying here who is not going to be cooped up in a room during the entire visit. It could be a little difficult to take a nap during the day, but we prefer to nap under palm trees in the wind on the beach! I’ve taken a few pictures of the current construction and the taco truck entrance.

I would have given this hotel four stars if not for the construction. We spent four nights here before a cruise. We received a free upgrade to a larger room with two queen beds and a kitchenette with a small stove (two burners), sink, basic dishes and a pot. We also had a mini-fridge with freezer and a microwave. You can find groceries at the Whaler's a few blocks away. The room had a small balcony that we didn't use because of street noise. The beds and pillows were very comfortable. There were plenty of drawers for storage, but not many hangers. The room was well lit but the bathroom was not--the lighting was very bad for putting on makeup. The bathroom had plenty of counter space and the shower head was good. Construction was a very noisy inconvenience and was expected to last for another three months. We heard pounding noises during the day, and we had to enter and leave through a crummy back alley. Once our water was turned off abruptly. I suggest waiting until construction is complete. The location is very good, near restaurants of all types and shopping. We had good meals at the Hard Rock Cafe, Eggs and Things, and the Yard House. We took the bus from a nearby stop to the zoo and to Diamond Head.

The Polynesian Residence is a very nice hotel with a restaurant, bar and very helpful and friendly staff. They offer a free area shuttle to get to area attractions and shopping and are very close to the beach. We enjoyed our stay and would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to Honolulu and we will stay again in the future.

This hotel was booked thru Expedia last Jan. 2018 for a few days lay over after a long cruise in April. When we arrived , we couldn't find the entrance and had to go in a shop to ask. Hotel was in FULL ALL OUT RENOVATION MODE. tarps hanging over doorways, no doors on the luggage room that should be secure, exposed wiring hanging down from ceilings, one chair in the tiny dirty lobby. It was unbelievable! I dont know how they should be open with hazards like that everywhere! We wanted to just relax by the pool for a couple days! Pool was closed and a green swamp. We desperately tried to find another place to stay but a convention had all the decent hotels booked solid! Very, very disappointed and will be demanding a refund from our rewards program! We are in our late 60's and had to tramp 6 blocks to the beach with beach chairs strapped to our backs. There was no mention of this reno going when we booked! There were a few very upset guests and I felt sorry for the one staff member running the desk! Clearly they were fed up trying to explain why the hotel looked like this. Ruined our last few days. Also it's located on a VERY busy street that is the Main Street through Wiakikik. Extremely noisy.....nothing but sirens and motorcycles all night long! Even when the renovation is done it is not a great place or location!

The entry to this hotel is very difficult to find. It is a doorway between shops and extremely uninviting (a dirty hallway to a desk) with an uninviting pool area. We almost left, but were really too tired and too burdened by luggage to want to find another place. Having said that, the room was a pleasant surprise. It was more than adequate, clean and decently appointed. There is no view. The beds were comfortable. You can't beat the location. It is on THE major shopping street and a short walk to the beach. Would I stay again? Probably not although the plusses outweigh the minuses. The staff and the room saved this from being a 3 star review.

Whilst the location is good and the price very reasonable the walls are paper thin so we could hear the neighbours playing music and talking the first night.When I rang the front desk he tried to tell me it was piped music throughout the hotel which I disputed as this was hip hop. He also declined to come up and hear for himself so I recorded it.then later on at approximately 2 am some drilling started which I once again rang about but the gent was not particularly interested.Next night there were late night revellers outside for ages so due to thin windows and doors once again no sleep.However initial receptionist was lovely and very helpful.

Great hotel if you want a relatively inexpensive option(with no hidden ammenities) near the beach. We stayed eight nights, and got upgraded to a room with a kitchenete at no extra cost! Book a room in front of the pool if you are sensitive to noise. Had a fantastic stay and hope to be back soon!

We stayed here for 6 nights. We had read that the entry was difficult to find. Our taxi driver knew exactly where to take us and pointed out the entry. It is a doorway between 2 shop fronts just near the Hard Rock. They are just about to renovate the office, which will give it a more up to date feel. They have staff available 24/7 who are very pleasant and helpful. Our room had a small balcony which overlooked the hustle and bustle of Kalakaua Ave, so its location is very central. It also had a small kitchenette which we intended to use but didn't. It had a microwave, hotplate, coffee machine and all crockery and cutlery needs. We had two queen sized beds, and the bathroom was recently renovated. I can't speak highly enough of the location. It was a walk to anywhere - the beach, shops, restaurants, and food trucks. There is no restaurant, but Polynesian Residences does provide a discount at nearby restaurants for all meals. There's a pool that we didn't use as we are beach goers, beach chairs available on request. I would recommend this hotel as it is affordable and centrally located and would not hesitate staying here in the future.

First, it's really well situated. Super location for walking around, yet we didn't hear the street noise from the busy shopping street or the Hard Rock Cafe nearby. Walk out the back door and you will be at a popular breakfast place. Walk next door and you will have a nice lunch at Tommy Bahama's. We walked everywhere, and didn't need a car, which would have been a hassle to park. This was just right for us, as we shy away from large hotels with enormous lobbies and prices to match. There being no lobby didn't bother us a bit.The room was comfortable and updated in every way - both the bed and the bathroom (the heated toilet seat was a surprise!). Staff was very helpful too.All in all, very happy with this choice.

My heart sunk when we finally found the entrance to the hotel but as they say don’t judge a book by its cover. The staff was amazing and eased my fears telling me that they had renovations for the front area coming but told me the main hotel will not disappoint me and it did not. The rooms are very spacious and well designed with Microwaves and refrigerators in every room. Some even have kitchenettes. And this helps for a place like Honolulu. It’s in the middle of all the action in Waikiki but away from the noise. The staff are amazing and work with you and the parking is very convenient even if it’s not on site but just a few minutes walk from the hotel. I will definitely be back and by then the lobby might be ready and if not who cares It’s worth every cent.

This is a hidden gem. Located on Kalakaua Ave near everything. Very inexpensive for Waikiki. $28 to park about 3 minutes away underground. Recently remodeled in contemporary style. Quiet location. Only a couple of blocks to Royal Hawaiian Center with tons of retail and restaurant options.

At first the entrance steered me away from checking in. I was concerned that the hotel was not going to live up to my expectation. There is no lobby, however, each floor has a nice spacious common space. I stayed in the Double Room and it was very nice and clean. The bathroom is quite disproportionately large for the space but nonetheless the Toto toilets were everything! Tommy Bahama toiletries and very attentive customer service. The hotel doesn't have any room service, however, offers discounts to area restaurants.
user_name:
Kristine G
New York City, New York

review_body: My husband and I stayed here in Dec and would definitely come here again. This is a no frills place but the rooms are newly renovated and clean. The lobby doesn’t have a wow factor like most hotel but not like you are spending time in the lobby. There is a small pool good for little kids. The hotel is across from luxury row and minutes from the beach, food truck area, and tons of restaurants. We had a room facing the pool and were able to watch the fireworks from our balcony that went off at the Hilton Village. If you are looking for a reasonably price place and walking distance to the main road this place is definitely worth checking out.

The 1st thing you need to do is get over the entrance way and lobby. Then you will discover that this is a nice little hotel, with very nice clean rooms and very good and pleasant staff. The location is fantastic and the hotel lends you beach equipment for your beach outings. No beach club fees, just nice clean rooms, great location and reasonable prices.

It is one of the most unusual hotel entrance I ever entered. We passed by the hotel 3 times and we still could not see the hotel entrance or locate the hotel. By chance we spotted the hotel name as we circled the place the 4th time. The entrance is small and narrow, maybe about 6 feet wide? Anyone would have missed the entrance even if you walk by, let alone locating it from a moving vehicle.But once after passing a small passage to the hotel reception, we were met with the friendly hotel reception staff.The room are big and comfortable. The free WIFI is stable and good. We had hired a car for our stay in Honolulu. The hotel has no free parking lots. We had to park our car at another public parking area which is about 10 minutes walk away. The daily parking rate, I think is US$25 per day! The hotel is located very near to the famous Waikiki beach and of course shopping and eating can be a breeze here. There is a small pool next to the reception area...but who wants to swim in a small pool when the famous Wakiki Beach is just walking minutes away! Overall a good hotel to stay, located minutes from Waikiki and plenty of shops and malls for shopping and of course plenty of eateries and restaurants!

My wife and I stayed here for twelve consecutive nights on a recent visit to Honolulu/Waikiki. We were really glad we found this hotel as it was perfect for what we were looking for. The Polynesian Residences, Waikiki Beach is ideally located on Kalakaua Avenue just one block to world-famous beaches and next to Waikiki's revitalized Beach Walk. The location was great and was within walking distance of great shopping and plenty of restaurants. Our room was recently upgraded, and everting was modern and felt new. The room was large enough that we didn't feel crowded. The bathroom was fairly large with plenty of shelf space to stay organized. The bed was comfortable. The employees were friendly. There was some street noise but not enough to be a problem. The Samsung tv was brand new. I would highly recommend this hotel for those looking for a clean, updated, fairly priced hotel in a perfect location for visiting Waikiki.

When we arrived for checked in we were not impressed of the entrance lobby. It was not inviting at all. My daughter and I were given our room card by a reception staff. We went into their small lift, at first try the card reader in the lift played up we have to try again several times before it accepted it. We reported the incident to the reception butnothing had been done until we checked out.The rooms were a good size. More modern than it looked from the outside. The location is more central . The room is clean and it was twin room. I love the bathroom especially the toilet with bidets. They provided us with coffee machine but I dont drink coffee so I requested for a hot water kettle so I can make my own green tea. I will recommend this accom for its location and cleanliness.

First impressions of this hotel are not the usual entrance, foyer but the staff at the desk are friendly and helpful. The rooms, on the other hand, are a pleasant surprise.After finding this hotel on line we were underwhelmed when we arrived but when we got to our room we were pleasantly surprised. It was clean and quiet, the bed was very comfortable and there was a great little tea/coffee machine that made a great coffee.It had a small balcony that didn't really have a view but it was good to get a bit of fresh air. The hotel is situated at the Honolulu end of Kalakaua Avenue just past The Hard Rock Cafe and before the park. It is an easy walk across the park to the beach and the restaurants and shops are just a two minute stroll away.There is no restaurant in the hotel which is not unusual in Waikiki but there is a fridge in the room and and ABC store and a Whalers convenience store just across the road.If your looking for a place with a view of the beach, this is not the place but if you want a grid hotel in a good location for a reasonable price then you should give this place a go.

We have been to Waikiki over 40 times since 1984. We had stayed at the Polynesian prior to the remodel and were EXTREMELY impressed with the decor, amenities and price for the location! The staff is off the charts! EVERY staff member was helpful & seemed genuinely happy to assist or greet you daily. The pool is not large and doesn't have a view but the staff will check out Tommy Bahama chairs for you to take to the beach not far away where the views of the ocean & Diamond Head will make an unforgettable impression. Toiletries were Tommy Bahama brand. A Keurig with a selection of coffee and tea was in our room and restocked everyday. A safe, a microwave, hairdryer, iron, heated toilet seat with a bidet option round out the room perks. The room, staff, location & value makes this a must when choosing a hotel in Waikiki!

Fantastic central location. Through an unassuming doorway you reach a reception staffed with cheerful and helpful folks. Up to the rooms, and they have a new, decent 4* feel to them. Clean, comfortable and modern - perfect for our short stay. There is a small pool, but we didn’t use it.

My fiance and I traveled here for a few days after being in Tokyo. Our plane arrived at 7a, and scheduled check-in was not until 3p. We called the hotel to ask when the earliest time was to check-in, and the lady at the front desk was absolutely wonderful. She pretty much told us to come on over and we will work something out. We ended up getting to our room at 9a!The hotel room itself was very nice. Beds were a bit more comfortable than I thought they'd be. The bathrooms were very nice, with a nice spacious shower, big sink and counter, and a heated toilet. The view from the hotel room was fun since it overlooked the shopping strip. We did experience three big problems. First, the drain in our shower was completely clogged. We attempted to contact maintenance but had no luck. My fiance actually had to take a knife and prop up the drain to unclog it. Second, the sliding door to our bedroom balcony was not closing properly. The noise from the outside traffic was easily coming into our room and it was quite loud. Third, when we went to return our pass for self-parking, there was no one at the counter to give the pass to. After waiting ten minutes we ended up leaving it on the counter with a note.The hotel main entrance doesn't really have a lobby. it is a mix of outside and inside concept. We did find 2 roaches running around the entrance floor, I guess that happens when the door is left open all day.

This place is fantastic, we stayed here from 12th - 20th December and was so happy with the location, room and the helpful staff. We stayed on the 3rd floor and the room was very spacious, there were 8 of us, 4 kids stayed in one room and that room was very big for them to put all their clothes, bags etc, we the parents stayed in their own rooms, 3 rooms costing us a little over $5000 which to me is a bargin in Hawaii.The location was central to everything you just walk out of your hotel and you have everything you need. We ate at the Hard Rock Café a couple of times which was two doors down, there is a short walk to the beach, about 4 minutes.Make sure you have breakfast at Eggs and things, great value.Everyday was perfect, temperature ranged between 25-28 degrees, a little rain but never a problem.You must also do Hanauma snorking day out, you see so many fish, great day out.Diamond head walk, once at the top you can see all of Waikiki.Loved Hawaii.

On the website there is a promotion where if you are staying for seven nights, the seventh night is free, No dates for the promotion are listed, nor is there an expiry, We will be in Honolulu for seven nights and were interested in staying at the Polynesian Residences. I emailed them and got one reply to say that if the website didn’t offer the promo them it might not apply. I emailed again and was told that they would need to check with sales, No reply. Emailed again. No reply.If this is indicative of how they care for their guests then it is a sad stare of affairs. Why offer a promo on their website where there are no restrictions mentioned, then not offer it, and even worse, blatantly ignore prospective guests????

I think I had a review of this hotel back in 2015 before it was upgraded. I liked it then for the location and friendly staff, but now it is fabulous. The entry is a bit like a narrow hall with no lobby, but that is minor. T he rooms have been upgraded so well. New bathrooms with great shower, a bidet (or washet as it was called), good toiletries. Didn't use the kitchenette, but has everything you would want even a Keurig so bring your favorite beverages. Would suggest buying at least breakfast items since breakfasts at the restaurants can be pricey. Again, the location couldn't be better - around the corner are buses to take you any place in Honolulu, shops, restaurants, parks, the shore, and my son's apartment is within walking distance. There isn't a "common room" as such, but there is a pool where families can gather.

I was a little scared by the pictures of a small entrance way but thought we would give it a try. Wonderful little gem!!! I’m glad we did! No place to park in front of entrance, not really a loading or unloading zone either. The lobby is not much at all. Simple desk and elevator and that’s about it. BUT...what it lacks in thrills it has in location, cleanliness and price. The front desk staff definitely show an Aloha spirit. Upon checkin, we were greeted with cool towels and cold water bottles. Each day they had a big smile on their face as we would leave and welcoming us back for the night. They were also very helpful with our questions. Our room looked exactly like the pics with Double beds. (Rm 306) Loved having a Japanese toilet. The room was clean. We had no problem with noise. We used the laundry facilities with no problem. We did need more cooking utensils but got by with what we had. Longs Drugs and ABC store across the street. Hard Rock Cafe around the corner. This hotel is located at the beginning of the shopping strip on Kalakaua Ave. We walked to the beach no problem (5min).  We would definitely stay here again! The place was clean, location was great and the price was worth it. I gave 4 stars because it does lack all the bells and whistles of a 5 star hotel. Also because the housekeeping never brought us four sets of towels for our stay. (Family of 4) *Recommend not getting a vehicle except for the day(s) you want to travel around the island. Most sites and restaurants are an easy walk, bus ride or Uber to/fro location.

Customer service with a friendly smile - thank you! Rooms are spacious, clean and very decent. The hotel is very centrally located in Waikiki - 5 minutes from the famous beach and literally on the shopping strip. There is also a pool that is very clean and well maintained. Overall, a very pleasant experience and I'd stay here again when I next visit Honolulu.

This hotel was amazing! The location was close to the beach, shops, restaurants, and everything you could want to do in and around Waikiki. The rooms are beautifully renovated, and we cooked most meals there. Beds are comfortable. Rooms are clean and bathroom is gorgeous! The staff was extremely friendly. Parking was $28 US, but I did some driving around/research, and this is actually a great deal. Plus you are able to come and go as needed. If you are a light sleeper I would recommend asking for a non street side, however the double pane doors/windows blocked 90% of the street noise. The ABC and drug store are very close for all your food needs. The pool area was nice, however my only disappointment would be there are no lounge chairs! When you log into their pool WiFi (WiFi strength was great everywhere) it even shows a picture of the pool with chairs. I would have spent much more time around the pool/sun deck if it had chairs. For the price, you can’t beat it!!

The hotel receptionists are all very friendly and helpful. This was the cheapest hotel we could find that wasn't run down. There is a pool that is usually always to yourself as not many guests use it. The hotel is situated at the start of the main strip on Kalakaua Ave so it is about a 7-10 minute walk to the main shops, but still close. It's a short walk down to the beach as well and is next to Hard Rock Cafe - about a 1 minute walk. Also closest ABC store is just across the road.

Wanted a room close to all the action, but didn't want to pay for all the amenities of the high end hotels, that we were never going to benefit from. We found just that. From the street the hotel appears difficult to find, with a single door leading into a corridor between shops, opening into a small reception area. Staff on reception always always smiling and helpful, with advice on local restaurants etc. Rooms spacious, as were the bathrooms, with modern furnishings and bathroom amenities, including an electrically controlled toilet. Rooms regularly serviced. Great value and would be happy to make a further reservation when we return to Oahu.

I live on the island but I hate traffic so if I go to town, I usually get a room. The first time my husband and I stayed her ended up losing his wallet. We looked everywhere, 4 weeks later we get a phone call.the wallet was found. Not only.did they return the wallet, they gave me a room for the weekend at a discount. The front desk is always helpful, and the girl remembers us from our first stay. I plan on coming back and recommend this hotel to others coming to oahu. Location is perfect

Missed my flight, never been/knew nothing about Oahu, booked this hotel and was pleasantly surprised by the outstanding new renovations and it’s middle of everything location. Had a great room with a view of the city. LOVED being able to walk to everything - beach, shopping, restaurants. The hotel has free beach towels and some beach toys like floats and snorkel gear which is nice. Coin laundry on almost every floor (careful b/c a couple of them malfunction). My room was beet spacious with a kitchenette and a nice modern shower. Really enjoyed my stay. *Note: The reception desk staff are less than helpful. I booked the room online with Agoda.com and the reception staff (first a lady and then a man) told me they don’t accept bookings from Agoda though I’d received an email confirmation and was showing it to them. Since I was there, frustrated, tired and loaded with luggage, I asked if he could just book my room directly and asked what the hotel’s rate was. He lied to me and ultimately charged me $70 MORE for that one night than I’d originally booked it for even though the hotel’s system price was about $20 less than what I’d booked it for. Great hotel rooms but be ware of the used car salesman at the front desk and book at your own risk.

Don’t stay here at this hotel. It’s hard to get to. You have to leave someone in the car on the beachwalk street to unload luggage.This is a very old hotel that they just threw in some cheap updated stuff over top of the old to make it look nicer.The first room we were given the keys didn’t work, then the next room was 2 twin beds which we book a king bed.Our final room was a king bed. The rooms look and feel like they are just lightly cleaned.The floors are slanted throughout the room. This place definitely has structural and foundational issues.Overnight parking is $28. Paid lots are a far walk; 20 minutes for $1/hour.The road noise and people, music, etc is incredibly loud from the hotel room. Hard to fall asleep.The beds are a bit too soft which can hurt your low back and hips.I would not recommend staying at this hotel at all.If you are just here to party and drink and need a place to crash then this place would be okay for you. If you are looking for a nice, comfortable, clean place to stay look elsewhere.

This is a great hotel for the price you pay. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay, the room was great, the bathroom was clean. I highly recommend it. Our room was on the 4th floor and overlooked Ala Moana Rd, theres is some outside noise that filters in especially during night (I think its from the parties at hard rock cafe, which is 2 doors down), but we had a baby with us and she was never woken up by it. So I don't think its a problem. The staff are friendly, they helped us with directions and recommendations. However if you're expecting a 5 star lobby you won't find that here, a corridor leads you to the reception desk and that's about it, no sitting areas or drinks. Before we booked this hotel, we were considering the hyatt centric, it was $800 dearer for the same days that we needed, I ended up going into the Hyatt centrics lobby so my little one could use the bathroom and it had all the bells and whistles of a 5 star hotel, but then you pay the price for it. So in the end the Polynesian was great for the price, the location is right at the start of the main strip.

Well what more can I say? The pictures shown of the hotel are EXACTLY as it is. Fully renovated rooms, clean, modern, sleek, spacious, huge modern bathroom.. couldn't have asked for anything more!From the outside and the reception area, the hotel doesn't look flash at all. Very plain, simple and basic. No bell concierge to meet and greet, definitely no fancy or inviting hotel entrance, if anything it was hot and stuffy as you enter into the small narrow walk way. I actually felt extremely worried upon checkin if the hotel was going to live up to my standard or had I booked an absolute disaster? Not a pleasant feeling at all when you know you have pre paid for a booking for 7 nights!!However, the friendly and welcoming reception host was a pleasure to deal with. Even more surprising was the offering of cold refreshment towels and water bottles. What a relief after dealing with the heatwave outside! It's these small simple gestures that make a huge difference when you first deal with the hotel! Well done! More surprisingly is when you first enter the modern mirrored lift and into the foyer of the floor level. Wow! Very spacious, clean and modern! Well decorated! Even better is when you enter the room itself. Totally blew my mind as I did not expect it to be as good as it was! Very impressive and extremely HAPPY with my choice. This room was going to be our home for the next 7 nights and thank goodness I knew immediately I would feel comfortable and relaxed being here!Overall, the Polynesian Residence is a basic hotel that doesn't offer all the bells and whistles as the other major chains. Like your buffet breakfast, concierge, trolley/bus transfer amenities etc. However, for the price you pay, the location of the hotel and the modern clean rooms, this totally outweighs being in a major hotel. As a family, we have been fortunate to have travelled to many destinations all over the world and our standard of hotels is quite high! This is our 4th trip to Hawaii and this would have to be one of our top hotels we've stayed at. We definitely will be back again and I wouldn't book anywhere else but the Polynesian Residence. So thank you to the staff and the hotel for making this trip one of our best and memorable holiday so far as a family. See you next time!!

In 1 word....WOW ! What a change I have witness at the polynesian plaza (now residences) We stayed here for 2 nights a few years ago & without mixing words-it was a dump!But now......what an amazing surprise upon arrival! Completely renovated to a much higher standard.....The pictures on the website are acurate! The location has always been the main factor but now the rooms have caught up.....Decor-bedding-bathrooms are all modern ,clean & well looked after. The large screen tv was an added bonus....the old run down elevator has been replaced with a modern one but still only the one. We stayed in a front (street) facing room & the room was relatively quiet to the noise outside so the soundproofing was upgraded as well. Big large bedside tables as well as a nice bedside clock just added to the enjoyment of our room but to our amazement the bathroom had a Bidet toilet.....Can't think of 1 other hotel that has this luxury! We also hired a car & parked a block away....this was a blessing in waikiki & we had no problem at all-I would only recommend you hire a compact car...parking was tight.....alittle pricey but we always had a guaranteed spot! Perfect!just a couple of little annoyances....we stayed 6 nights & the pool was not available to us as it was being refilled.....not sure why- 90 most days so it would of been nice. Also we booked our room well in advance and asked for a high floor pool facing room but upon arrival none was available (it's always the little things)At any rate we loved our stay & will be back & really that says it all!! Well done....you guys rock!

wonderful. bed was comfortable. room was exceptionally clean, and very spacious. location wise is fantastic. 5 minutes walk to waikiki beach, next to hard rock cafe.no complaint really. will definitely come back again.

We recently stayed here at the Polynesian Residences and were satisfied with our stay. Firstly, the hotel is a little tricky to find but we just asked around the shops nearby and shortly after located where we needed to be. Would suggest Google mapping it first so you know what you're looking for. I agree with the other reviewers in that the lobby/reception area needs a facelift. It doesn't look pleasant or welcoming which is a shame because the staff and rooms themselves are great. We were welcomed with cold towels, which was refreshing. Our studio double was comfortable, modern and clean. Air conditioning worked well and was quiet. The traffic was a little loud but if you want location then you can't really avoid this. Opposite the hotel is all the high-end shops like Tiffany & Co, Gucci, LV etc and the hotel is a short 10-15min walk from the centre of Waikiki. We would stay again!

We are currently staying here and truly could not be happier. After a very bad night at another place while visiting Waikiki, we reached out at the last minute for a room. Thankfully we discovered what turned out to be a place of wonderful respite. We walked to the hotel and of course got lost. Finally reaching our destination to be greeted with cool towels and immediate check in. The staff was absolutely wonderful. I highly recommend staying here. You will not be disappointed! So glad we are here! Now I am going to enjoy their pool!

We were pleasantly surprised with the Polyesian residences. We made a last minute (and inexpensive) reservation and so we didn't expect much. It was wonderful - the staff was friendly and helpful, the room was recently renovated and very clean. The bed was comfortable and the location was great. After we checked out, they held our luggage all day. We returned to pick up our luggage at the end of the day, feeling tired, hot, and footsore. A lovely front desk attendant, Tee, offered us (free) cold bottles of water and towels so that we could soak our feet in the pool while waiting for our Uber. She even helped us to the car with our luggage. What a wonderful way to end the day! Service was above and beyond expectations. I highly recommend them.

We have been in Waikiki 6 times and we tried a lot of hotels. This time we decided to try the Polynesian Residences due to recent renovation (I heard it was completed in May 2017).Location is great, right in the middle of everything.Rooms are good in size and furniture.However, it seems that the property is still in a startup phase and needs to fix a lot of small inconvenients as well as the staff needs to be more trained.We hope the level of maintenance will improve over time and the post-refurbishment level will improve and do not decrease.We appreciated a lot the late check-out.An advise: please renovate the lobby area and entrance!Pricewise it was very good at 150$

This place is all about location! It's right on the strip and I recommend it if you are traveling on a budget. Beds are queen so rather small for two people. Rooms with a kitchenette are rather smaller. They give you beach towels which is great. They have a very tiny pool but I always wonder who needs a pool in Hawaii!! Very friendly and helpful staff. No restaurant or breakfast. It's a very simple hotel but very clean.

We booked the room to be close to other family staying on the beach. We were right in the middle of the city and everything was within walking distance. The room was very clean and comfortable. The staff was very nice and helpful. We only stayed a few days and we had no issues. The price was reasonable for the area it was located. They were doing updates because there were pieces of furniture sitting in the elevator area on our floor. It didn't disturb us in anyway but you could see they were doing updates.

I was concerned with negative reviews at first, but was truly surprised to find the guest rooms completely renovated with tastefully modern design (new beds, bathroom, big screen TV, kitchenette, etc) with complimentary WiFi, perfect for a week stay in Hawaii. Location was excellent- close to shopping similar to Rodeo Drive in LA; Hard Rock Cafe and Tommy Bahama just around the corner and the beach was just a 10 minute stroll away... it was a bargain for the price.
